title: Help a fellow noob
body: Hi guys. I wouldnt say i am a beginner at this game as i get the occasional carry game. But i usually find myself with low kills compared to team mates. I was hoping for some advice on poking and knowing when to attack your opponent. I do poke at opposing laners but i always find myself not being able to finish them off either due to lack of strategy of out of mana. Any help i will be grateful for.

replies.body: it really depends on who you are playing. which champs are you playing where you are running out of mana? and what lane?
i usually play mid and at the moment and  i am trying to learn ryze. Any tips.

I have not played ryze since his rework, but generally ryze had a pretty meh early game. you should really be playing him top and harass with your auto attacks. Or if you really wanna play him mid i suggesting starting dorans ring.
i dont like starting with dorans ring as i t cant be built into any items. i find it just a waste of money, but i guess the extra health would be useful?.....
Start mana star or crystal whatever its called, bcz ryze scales off mana its more dmg
ok i will try it

Read up on how Ryze works since his update. He's weak early on but if you can work up his passive then you can trade quite well early in lane with those "power spikes" he gets. 

And as a general tip, play some ARAM. Still focus on SR but ARAM is great for trying new champions out and getting a feel for team fights (because thats pretty much the entire mode)
yeh havent played aram yet. i thought you got to pick your own hero ad shit as i hadnt read on that gameplay. will be sure to play that  soon. thanks for the tip :)
Yeah dont play him mid :P i hate his skillshot now ruins full smart cast ;-; but hes still decent
if someones in a group of there minions use e
yeh i got that down. what items do you recommend for making his spells do considerate damage.
Buy a tear, then build Rod of Ages, then finish Archangels. The rest is up to you, but build AP and Mana heavy because he scales extra AP off his maximum mana.
yeh i have figued that out and i will build the archangles. thanks for the suppot. :)
i lke the idea of skillshots personally but i just need to know what to build to make my abilities to do moer damage.
MANA XD
Just go Nunu smite/exhaust (full ap) support and push lane constantly Kappa
yeh i can see why that would work but i am not very fond of support. I always find myself going in for the kill after adc has given up and then i usually die. Not my best role hahh

Maybe go Nami? shes not tanky.. but if she lands bubble on an enemy that is fleeing lel
And her w bounces off enemys so ks time :D
haha yeh i find it funny when players go rage because of ks

Remember to strike when u hav enough energy / mana, that way u do more damage.
Be sure that you know that their summoner spells r on cooldown, e.g: Flash, Ignite
If you do main the champ that ur facing, try to remember the cooldowns!
I always engage when their pushing me, that way ik that they won't hav a gank from the jungler and also they dont go to their turret straight away
If their low, and u r also, i urge u not to engage!
If their low and u arent, then go in, if u hav enough mana / energy, which leads to ENGAGE WHEN ALL YOUR SPELLS ARENT ON COOLDOWN that way u deal more damage and more chance of a kill!

And most of all, dont rage! Raging is the worst thing you could do in the game, it tells that u hav given up, dont give up, if ur top / mid / adc / jg just farm, if ur a supp then just stay with ur adc.

I hope this helps :)
yeh these tips were very helpful thank you. Also i hate giving up. I am always the last person to agree to a surrender but i find it angers my team.
I think it's just that you don't realize when your powerspike is. Poking in lane is fine but when you find that you're going to reach that curve make sure you save that mana
ok thanks for the tip
